covid_data_handler module¶

Module name: covid_data_handler.py

Description:

  • Module containing the main program for handling Covid-19 infection rates, hospitalisation and death rates.

Last modified on: 02/12/21

Author: Destyny Ho

covid_data_handler.covid_API_request(location: str = 'Exeter', location_type: str = 'ltla') → str¶

Uses the covid API to request data from locations parsed as arguments.

Parameters:

  • location (string): Defaultly set to ‘Exeter’; this takes the location from the config file.

  • location_type (string): Defaultly set to ‘ltla’; this takes the location_type from the config file.

covid_data_handler.parse_csv_data(csv_filename)¶

Converts a csv file into a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • csv_filename: The filename of the csv to be parsed.

covid_data_handler.process_covid_csv_data(covid_csv_data)¶

Processes csv data which returns the last 7 days’ cases, current hospital cases and total deaths.

Parameters:

  • covid_csv_data: The data fetched from the csv file using parse_csv_data.

covid_data_handler.schedule_covid_updates(update_interval: int, update_name: str) → str¶

Schedules updates using the sched module. NOTE: Not used in app.py because I opted to use the threading option instead.

Parameters:

  • update_interval (int): Takes an interval for updates to happen.

  • update_name (string): Takes the update name.
